alert.note: Alert for Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 21 at 5:29PM MDT until June 21 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... South central Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 529 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles north of Whitaker, or 30 miles north of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Laramie and south central Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 39 and 51. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.
